name: growler
content:
growler noun [C]
(BEER CONTAINER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly US informal a jug or large bottle that can be filled with beer, especially at a brewery (= a place where beer is made). A growler usually contains 64 fluid ounces: I stop by once every week or so to get my growler refilled. Beer and root beer is brewed at the facility, and half-gallon growlers are sold there. Compare
howler (BEER CONTAINER)
More examplesFewer examplesThe brewpubs can also sell "growlers," half-gallon jugs filled at the tap for the customer who wants to bring some beer home.The beer is sold both on draft by the glass and by the half-gallon growler to go.Tonight would be the perfect night for some ribs and a growler of cold local beer.

growler noun [C]
(PERSON)
someone who makes a growling sound (= a low, rough sound) when they sing or speak: I love Tom Waits and this is one of my favourites from the old growler.
More examplesFewer examplesThe singer is from London, but his vocals aim for the smoky drawl of a bourbon growler from Tennessee. Tam White is Scotland's favourite blues growler.The player is also known as Ringhio - growler - or Pitbull.

growler noun [C]
(SEA ICE)
a mass of ice in the sea, especially one that has broken off a larger iceberg or glacier: He reported hitting a growler, a rogue fragment of iceberg, while doing over 12 knots.
More examplesFewer examplesWe had hit a small, all-but-melted iceberg - a " growler " - that barely broke the surface but still bashed a dent in our bows.You can learn about iceberg towing and the life cycles of growlers and bergies.
